Package edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle

Class CapsuleObstacle

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.Obstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.SimpleObstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.CapsuleObstacle
Direct Known Subclasses:
DudeModel, Enemy
public class CapsuleObstacle extends SimpleObstacle
Box-shaped model to support collisions. Unless otherwise specified, the center of mass is as the center.

  • Constructor Details

    • CapsuleObstacle

      public CapsuleObstacle(float width, float height)
      Creates a new box at the origin. The orientation of the capsule will be a full capsule along the major axis. If width == height, it will default to a vertical orientation. The size is expressed in physics units NOT pixels. In order for drawing to work properly, you MUST set the drawScale. The drawScale converts the physics units to pixels.
      Parameters:
      width - The object width in physics units
      height - The object width in physics units

    • CapsuleObstacle

      public CapsuleObstacle(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Creates a new capsule object. The orientation of the capsule will be a full capsule along the major axis. If width == height, it will default to a vertical orientation. The size is expressed in physics units NOT pixels. In order for drawing to work properly, you MUST set the drawScale. The drawScale converts the physics units to pixels.
      Parameters:
      x - Initial x position of the box center
      y - Initial y position of the box center
      width - The object width in physics units
      height - The object width in physics units

    • CapsuleObstacle

      public CapsuleObstacle(float x, float y, float width, float height, CapsuleObstacle.Orientation o)
      Creates a new capsule object width the given orientation. The size is expressed in physics units NOT pixels. In order for drawing to work properly, you MUST set the drawScale. The drawScale converts the physics units to pixels.
      Parameters:
      x - Initial x position of the box center
      y - Initial y position of the box center
      width - The object width in physics units
      height - The object width in physics units

  • Method Details

    • getDimension

      public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getDimension()
      Returns the dimensions of this box This method does NOT return a reference to the dimension vector. Changes to this vector will not affect the shape. However, it returns the same vector each time its is called, and so cannot be used as an allocator.
      Returns:
      the dimensions of this box

    • setDimension

      public void setDimension(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 value)
      Sets the dimensions of this box This method does not keep a reference to the parameter.
      Parameters:
      value - the dimensions of this box

    • setOrientation

      public boolean setOrientation(CapsuleObstacle.Orientation value)
      Sets the orientation of this capsule, if valid. If the orientation is not valid, then nothing happens and the method return false.
      Parameters:
      value - the orientation of this capsule
      Returns:
      true if the orientation was successfully changed.

    • isHorizontal

      protected static boolean isHorizontal(CapsuleObstacle.Orientation value)
      Returns true if the orientation is a horizontal full or half capsule.
      Parameters:
      value - the orientation to check
      Returns:
      true if the orientation is a horizontal full or half capsule.

    • setSeamOffset

      public void setSeamOffset(float value)
      Sets the seam offset of the core rectangle If the center rectangle is exactly the same size as the circle radius, you may get catching at the seems. To prevent this, you should make the center rectangle epsilon narrower so that everything rolls off the round shape. This parameter is that epsilon value

    • getSeamOffset

      public float getSeamOffset()
      Returns the seam offset of the core rectangle If the center rectangle is exactly the same size as the circle radius, you may get catching at the seems. To prevent this, you should make the center rectangle epsilon narrower so that everything rolls off the round shape. This parameter is that epsilon value
      Returns:
      the seam offset of the core rectangle

    • getDebugColor

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color getDebugColor()
      Returns the color to display the physics outline
      Returns:
      the color to display the physics outline

      Parameters:

    • resize

      private void resize(float width, float height)
      Reset the polygon vertices in the shape to match the dimension.

    • setDensity

      public void setDensity(float value)
      Sets the density of this body The density is typically measured in usually in kg/m^2. The density can be zero or positive. You should generally use similar densities for all your fixtures. This will improve stacking stability.
      Overrides:
      setDensity in class SimpleObstacle
      Parameters:
      value - the density of this body

    • createFixtures

      protected void createFixtures()
      Create new fixtures for this body, defining the shape This is the primary method to override for custom physics objects
      Specified by:
      createFixtures in class SimpleObstacle

    • releaseFixtures

      protected void releaseFixtures()
      Release the fixtures for this body, reseting the shape This is the primary method to override for custom physics objects
      Specified by:
      releaseFixtures in class SimpleObstacle

    • drawDebug

      public void drawDebug(GameCanvas canvas)
      Draws the outline of the physics body. This method can be helpful for understanding issues with collisions.
      Specified by:
      drawDebug in class Obstacle
      Parameters:
      canvas - Drawing context
